channel.title: Man Beheads Sister, Stabs Another
channel.description:
Kerby Revelus, a 23-year-old Milton, MA man has stabbed his 17-year-old sister, Samantha, and decapitated his 5-year-old sister, Bianca. Sky News reports that the incident took place the day after Bianca's birthday. Nine-year-old sister Serafina has been hospitalized for defensive stab wounds. [b]Man Beheads Sister: Circumstances Leading Up to the Incident[/b] The incident had taken place the day after 5-year-old Bianca's birthday. Nine-year-old Serafina called 911 as Kerby stabbed 17-year-old Samantha with a household knife. Police arrived in less than a minute and witnessed Kerby decapitating his sister Bianca. Police shot Kerby to death to prevent him from going after Serafina. There is no direct motive for why he assaulted and stabbed is sisters. Neighbors report that they are a solid family with good kids and hard-working parents. According to the Boston Globe, Samantha was a high-school student who was well-respected by her teachers and peers. She was an honor roll student and a member of the Poetry Club and the Caribbean Cape Verdean Club. Five-year-old Bianca had looked forward to starting kindergarten. The only possible precursors to the incident were that Kerby had gotten into a fist fight with a neighbor the day before. Also, neighbors report that he had recently been depressed and discouraged since leaving prison. Although he had been looking for a job, his previous criminal record had prevented him from finding work. He had been arrested in 2005 and 2007 for gun charges, but was trying to change his life.
sauce: http://www.associatedcontent.com/article/1609002/man_beheads_sister_stabs_another.html

Think about how much goverment money it saved![/quote]Not necessarily, when a cop kills someone there is a lot of paper work that has to be done, and CSI (or other form of groups) have to investigate to see if the cop did it for a probable reason etc…

item.title: Man Beheads Sister, Stabs Another
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:14, topic:270283”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=356726.msg2728153#msg2728153 date=1238519364]

I think most criminals should be shot on scene (if they are guilty ie this guy!) Think about how much goverment money it saved!

What about people that look like criminals, but are as innocent as a wet pussy? What if your dad witnessed a robbery, and the police think he is the suspect. Should they shoot him?

So… If you see a guy ripping someones head off, you say the guy next to him is guilty?

I wasn’t talking about this case. You said most criminals, and as there was only one criminal in this case I suspected you were talking about criminals in general. So I gave the example of your dad witnessing a robbery.
[/quote]

I was talking about situations like this and possibly a little less worse.[/quote]
I know, if you can avoid killing a criminal, avoid it.
If they had to shot they could shoot a non-lethal shoot.
Death penalty is not a good solution.

Read full topic

But in this case the police had to shoot him.
